PrivacyPolicy.title: Focus Fine Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how the Focus Fine team (“we”) processes information when you use the Focus Fine mobile application (“App”), which blocks distracting applications to improve productivity.

1.title: 1. Privacy Principle
1.content:
We respect your privacy. Blocking settings and focus-related data are processed locally on your device whenever possible.
We do not analyze which specific apps you block or for how long, except where this is necessary for the App’s operation or analytics.

2_1.title: 2.1. Blocking Data
items: names and package identifiers (Package ID) of blocked applications;
blocking duration, schedules, “Strict Mode,” and protection settings;
early unlock fee configuration.

2_2.title: 2.2. Technical and Account Data
items: User identifier (User ID) via Firebase Authentication;
purchase history via Google Play In-App Purchases;
logs of blocking and unblocking actions;
device identifiers and technical data via the Firebase Software Development Kit (Firebase SDK);
email address if you contact support.
2_2.footer: We do not store full payment information (such as payment card numbers).

3.title: 3. Use of Android Accessibility Service
3.content: The App uses the Android Accessibility Service solely to provide the core functionality of the App — blocking applications selected by the user during active focus sessions.

3_1.title: 3.1. Purpose of Using the Android Accessibility Service
3_1.content: The Android Accessibility Service is used only to:
items: detect when a user attempts to open an application they have chosen to block;
immediately deny access to that application during an active blocking session.
3_1.footer: Without the Android Accessibility Service, the App would not be able to reliably and effectively enforce application blocking on Android devices.

3_2.title: 3.2. Data Processed Within the Android Accessibility Service
3_2.content: Within the scope of the Android Accessibility Service, the App processes:
items: the package identifier (Package ID) of the application currently in the foreground;
changes in application state (foreground or background).
3_2.footer: All data processing related to the Android Accessibility Service takes place locally on the user’s device.

3_3.title: 3.3. Prohibited Use
3_3.content: The App does not use the Android Accessibility Service to:
items: read, record, or analyze screen content;
read entered text, passwords, or keystrokes;
monitor user actions outside of the applications chosen to be blocked;
collect data for advertising or profiling purposes;
transmit Android Accessibility Service data to external servers or third parties.

3_4.title: 3.4. User Control
items: The Android Accessibility Service is disabled by default;
the user must explicitly enable it in the device's system settings;
the user may disable the Android Accessibility Service at any time through the device’s system settings.

4.title: 4. Use of Data
items: providing App functionality;
processing payments;
improving performance and stability;
customer support.

5.title: 5. Data Sharing
5.content: Data is not sold. It may be shared only with:
items: Google Play and payment processing services;
analytics and infrastructure services (such as Firebase);
when required by law.

6.title: 6. Data Security
items: Data is encrypted in transit using secure communication protocols (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure – HTTPS / Secure Sockets Layer – SSL).
Sensitive blocking settings are stored locally or in a secure environment.
Complete security on the internet cannot be guaranteed.

7.title: 7. Children’s Privacy
items: The App is not intended for children under the age of 13.
We do not knowingly collect personal data from children.

8.title: 8. Your Rights
8.content: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to access your data, request its correction or deletion, and obtain information about data processing.

9.title: 9. Legal Basis for Data Processing
9.content: Within the European Economic Area (EEA), data is processed based on:
items: performance of a contract (providing the App);
compliance with legal obligations;
our legitimate interests (security, analytics, improvements).

10.title: 10. Data Processing Outside the European Union
items: We use Google services (Firebase, Google Play) whose servers may be located outside the European Union (EU).
Data transfers are carried out in accordance with the GDPR using European Commission–approved Standard Contractual Clauses or other appropriate mechanisms.

11.title: 11. Changes to This Policy
11.content: This Privacy Policy may be updated. The current version will always be available in the App or on the Google Play page.
